text.tspan: In the story of Fidelion, soldiers and harriers wear gas masks either to
protect their identity from severe consequences or to instill fear in their
enemies. The color red is associated with death, blood, and war.
In Fidelia, gas masks can symbolize either the
individuals who dissent from the power
structure. The use of gas masks in Fidelia
evokes feelings of dread and the implication of
This two-legged beast serves as a significant addition to the
Fidelian Empire's arsenal, equipped with a single extended
cannon and two beaming lights on the front. It is powered by
engine and diesel and is used by the Fidelian Empire in their
Under Jake's command, an aide and brilliant engineer
developed even more advanced military technology,
eventually creating a powerful and destructive bipedal
In the background of this powerful
Rowan had served as Jake's right-hand
man even before the war and is still
considered the best tactician in the
Celine, who was discovered in a small
quickly rose to prominence in Fidelia
For years, the Fidelian Empire ruled
using highly trained soldiers to establish
the support of powerful allies such as the
regime was unstoppable, and no one
The Fidelian army is well-trained and prepared to face any threat. However, the general public's understanding of
the Fidelian military is limited to what they have been taught. The Fidelian army has its own unique culture,
language, and military practices, and may seem overwhelming, strict, and intimidating to those who have had
little or no exposure to military culture.
Fidelion is organized as a vertical society, with social
status determined by one's position on the ladder. It
serves as both a fort and an oil drilling device, standing
at the center of Fidelia and supported by three pillars. It
continuously extracts oil, which is considered as
valuable as gold by Jake Marcus and everyone else.
The Jake's room is located in the middle and top of
Fidelion, respectively, and Jake can oversee the city and
its people from his balcony. From this vantage point, he
makes announcements, lives extravagantly, and wields
To achieve this, he began raiding surrounding villages and forcing them to
join his army and work for him. Although people noticed that his greed had
become excessive, they still followed him due to his effective leadership.
Over time, Jake began to treat the villages as colonies, attacking and
annexing them, forcing the men to become slaves and soldiers, and the
women and children to become workers and slaves.
The oil city of Texas that Jake
However, as he grew older, Jake
wanted more and sought to acquire
technology to protect his people and
The workers are depicted in the lower left corner of the logo, the
pipe that transports the oil is depicted in the middle, and the armies
and soldiers are depicted in the right corner. These three bars
represent the support that Fidelion receives.
The central part of the logo
represents the heart of Fidelion, an
empire ruled by the upper class.
The upper part of the logo represents the oil
factory, where Fidelia extracts and processes
oil from the ground beneath it.
In Fidelia, there is a strict division
between the upper and lower classes,
with Jake's army working to keep the
lower class in its place and prevent
them from rising up. The army uses
this rule to demonstrate its strength
Jake and his followers realized that oil would be a
crucial resource for the surviving human population. Due
to the powerful EMPs from the nuclear war, all electronic
devices had stopped functioning, and most pre-war
internal combustion engines that relied on electronic
devices could not be used. However, machines with
mechanical control devices had preserved knowledge,
and older engines could be installed and used for
production. Ensuring a supply of fuel to run these
engines, along with producing food, became a top
priority for the survival of humanity.
After a long journey, Jake and his followers were able to
establish a new civilization by restarting oil drilling
operations. However, their settlement was disrupted by a
group of bandits and gangsters who threatened and
attacked their village, stealing valuable resources.
Determined to bring justice, Jake led a small group of
soldiers in a campaign against the bandits, using various
strategies and motivated by a desire for revenge. With
the support of the villagers, Jake used all of his strength
and abilities to achieve his goals.
One day, a riot broke out due to a shortage of resources. Jake,
who did not intend to cause the riot, ended up playing a role
in starting it and became the leader of the rebels. He emerged
from the bunker with some supplies and weapons, followed
When Jake was five years old, a nuclear war broke out and he,
along with his parents, took refuge in an underground bunker
where they lived for 15 years under strict control.
Jake was not the brightest kid of his age before, but through
this tragic event of humanity, he lost his smile, childhood, and
sense of happiness. From then on, he struggled to understand
Jake's distorted thinking manifested in cruel behavior towards insects
and animals. However, he was also intelligent and had a natural talent
for art. He particularly enjoyed listening to Beethoven's only opera,
"Fidelio," which his mother often played for him.
Before the war, Jake Marcus was a typical child from a wealthy family.
He was raised with a privileged perspective and had difficulty
connecting with people outside of his social circle. As he was growing
up, he grappled with questions about justice and struggled to find
world. The systems that supported society
functioning, and the world was plunged

aftermath of the war, and 94% of
lucky enough to find shelter in
prepared in advance, but all were
